trans-unit.source: Enterprise-class WordPress on Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Enterprise-class WordPress on Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to host an enterprise-class WordPress site on Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Learn how to host an enterprise-class WordPress site on Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Azure App Service provides a scalable, secure and easy to use environment for mission critical, large scale <linkText>WordPress[wordpress]</linkText><title></title> sites.
trans-unit.target: Azure App Service provides a scalable, secure and easy to use environment for mission critical, large scale <linkText>WordPress[wordpress]</linkText><title></title> sites.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft itself runs enterprise-class sites such as the <linkText>Office[officeblog]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Bing[bingblog]</linkText><title></title> blogs.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft itself runs enterprise-class sites such as the <linkText>Office[officeblog]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Bing[bingblog]</linkText><title></title> blogs.

trans-unit.source: This document shows you how you can use Azure App Service Web Apps to establish and maintain an enterprise-class, cloud-based WordPress site that can handle a large volume of visitors.
trans-unit.target: This document shows you how you can use Azure App Service Web Apps to establish and maintain an enterprise-class, cloud-based WordPress site that can handle a large volume of visitors.

trans-unit.source: A basic WordPress installation has only two requirements.
trans-unit.target: A basic WordPress installation has only two requirements.

trans-unit.source: MySQL Database - available through ClearDB in the Azure Marketplace[cdbnstore], or you can manage your own MySQL installation on Azure Virtual Machines using either Windows[mysqlwindows] or Linux[mysqllinux].
trans-unit.target: MySQL Database - available through ClearDB in the Azure Marketplace[cdbnstore], or you can manage your own MySQL installation on Azure Virtual Machines using either Windows[mysqlwindows] or Linux[mysqllinux].

trans-unit.source: ClearDB provides several MySQL configurations, with different performance characteristics for each configuration.
trans-unit.target: ClearDB provides several MySQL configurations, with different performance characteristics for each configuration.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Azure Store[cdbnstore]</linkText><title></title> for information on offerings provided through the Azure store or <linkText>ClearDB pricing</linkText><title></title> for offerings directly from ClearDB.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Azure Store[cdbnstore]</linkText><title></title> for information on offerings provided through the Azure store or <linkText>ClearDB pricing</linkText><title></title> for offerings directly from ClearDB.

trans-unit.source: PHP 5.2.4 or greater - Azure App Service currently provide PHP versions 5.3, 5.4, and 5.5[phpwebsite].
trans-unit.target: PHP 5.2.4 or greater - Azure App Service currently provide PHP versions 5.3, 5.4, and 5.5[phpwebsite].

trans-unit.source: We recommend always running on the latest version of PHP to ensure you have the latest security fixes.
trans-unit.target: We recommend always running on the latest version of PHP to ensure you have the latest security fixes.

trans-unit.source: Using just the basic requirements, you could create a basic solution within an Azure region.
trans-unit.target: Using just the basic requirements, you could create a basic solution within an Azure region.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>an Azure web app and MySQL Database hosted in a single Azure region</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>an Azure web app and MySQL Database hosted in a single Azure region</linkText>

trans-unit.source: While this would allow you to scale out your application by creating multiple Web Apps instances of the site, everything is hosted within the data centers in a specific geographic region.
trans-unit.target: While this would allow you to scale out your application by creating multiple Web Apps instances of the site, everything is hosted within the data centers in a specific geographic region.

trans-unit.source: Visitors from outside this region may see slow response times when using the site, and if the data centers in this region go down, so does your application.
trans-unit.target: Visitors from outside this region may see slow response times when using the site, and if the data centers in this region go down, so does your application.

trans-unit.source: Using Azure <linkText>Traffic Manager[trafficmanager]</linkText><title></title>, it's possible to scale your WordPress site across multiple geographic regions while providing only one URL for visitors.
trans-unit.target: Using Azure <linkText>Traffic Manager[trafficmanager]</linkText><title></title>, it's possible to scale your WordPress site across multiple geographic regions while providing only one URL for visitors.

trans-unit.source: All visitors come in through Traffic Manager and are then routed to a region based on the load balancing configuration.
trans-unit.target: All visitors come in through Traffic Manager and are then routed to a region based on the load balancing configuration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>an Azure web app, hosted in multiple regions, using CDBR High Availability router to route to MySQL across regions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>an Azure web app, hosted in multiple regions, using CDBR High Availability router to route to MySQL across regions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Within each region, the WordPress site would still be scaled across multiple Web Apps instances, but this scaling is region specific; high traffic regions can be scaled differently than low traffic ones.
trans-unit.target: Within each region, the WordPress site would still be scaled across multiple Web Apps instances, but this scaling is region specific; high traffic regions can be scaled differently than low traffic ones.

trans-unit.source: Replication and routing to multiple MySQL Databases can be done using ClearDB's <linkText>CDBR High Availability Router[cleardbscale]</linkText><title></title> (shown left,) or <linkText>MySQL Cluster CGE[cge]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Replication and routing to multiple MySQL Databases can be done using ClearDB's <linkText>CDBR High Availability Router[cleardbscale]</linkText><title></title> (shown left,) or <linkText>MySQL Cluster CGE[cge]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If the site will accept uploads, or host media files, use Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: If the site will accept uploads, or host media files, use Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: If you need caching, consider <linkText>Redis cache[rediscache]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Memcache Cloud</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>MemCachier</linkText><title></title>, or one of the other caching offerings in the <linkText>Azure Store</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you need caching, consider <linkText>Redis cache[rediscache]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Memcache Cloud</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>MemCachier</linkText><title></title>, or one of the other caching offerings in the <linkText>Azure Store</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>an Azure web app, hosted in multiple regions, using CDBR High Availability router for MySQL, with Managed Cache, Blob storage, and CDN</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>an Azure web app, hosted in multiple regions, using CDBR High Availability router for MySQL, with Managed Cache, Blob storage, and CDN</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Blob storage is geo-distributed across regions by default, so you don't have to worry about replicating files across all sites.
trans-unit.target: Blob storage is geo-distributed across regions by default, so you don't have to worry about replicating files across all sites.

trans-unit.source: You can be also enable the Azure <linkText>Content Distribution Network (CDN)[cdn]</linkText><title></title> for Blob storage, which distributes files to end nodes closer to your visitors.
trans-unit.target: You can be also enable the Azure <linkText>Content Distribution Network (CDN)[cdn]</linkText><title></title> for Blob storage, which distributes files to end nodes closer to your visitors.

trans-unit.target: To do this...

trans-unit.target: Use this...

trans-unit.target: Upload or store large files

trans-unit.target: <linkText>WordPress plugin for using Blob storage[storageplugin]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: Send email

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SendGrid[storesendgrid]</linkText><title></title> and the <linkText>WordPress plugin for using SendGrid[sendgridplugin]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SendGrid[storesendgrid]</linkText><title></title> and the <linkText>WordPress plugin for using SendGrid[sendgridplugin]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: Custom domain names

trans-unit.target: HTTPS

trans-unit.source: Pre-production validation
trans-unit.target: Pre-production validation

trans-unit.source:
Set up staging environments for web apps in Azure App Service[staging]

Note that switching a web app from staging to production also moves the WordPress configuration. You should ensure that all settings are updated to the requirements for your production app before switching the staged app into production.
trans-unit.target:
Set up staging environments for web apps in Azure App Service[staging]

Note that switching a web app from staging to production also moves the WordPress configuration. You should ensure that all settings are updated to the requirements for your production app before switching the staged app into production.

trans-unit.target: Monitoring and troubleshooting

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable diagnostics logging for web apps in Azure App Service[log]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Monitor Web Apps in Azure App Service[monitor]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploy a web app in Azure App Service[deploy]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Back up a web app in Azure App Service[backup]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Restore a web app in Azure App Service[restore]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Performance in the cloud is achieved primarily through caching and scale out; however the memory, bandwidth, and other attributes of Web Apps hosting should also be taken into consideration.
trans-unit.target: Performance in the cloud is achieved primarily through caching and scale out; however the memory, bandwidth, and other attributes of Web Apps hosting should also be taken into consideration.

trans-unit.target: To do this...

trans-unit.target: Use this...

trans-unit.target: Understand App Service instance capabilities

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Pricing details, including capabilities of App Service tiers[websitepricing]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Cache resources
trans-unit.target: Cache resources

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Redis cache[rediscache]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Memcache Cloud</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>MemCachier</linkText><title></title>, or one of the other caching offerings in the <linkText>Azure Store</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Redis cache[rediscache]</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Memcache Cloud</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>MemCachier</linkText><title></title>, or one of the other caching offerings in the <linkText>Azure Store</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Scale your application
trans-unit.target: Scale your application

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale a web app in Azure App Service[websitescale]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>ClearDB High Availability Routing[cleardbscale]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale a web app in Azure App Service[websitescale]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>ClearDB High Availability Routing[cleardbscale]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to host and manage your own MySQL installation, you should consider <linkText>MySQL Cluster CGE[cge]</linkText><title></title> for scale out
trans-unit.target: If you choose to host and manage your own MySQL installation, you should consider <linkText>MySQL Cluster CGE[cge]</linkText><title></title> for scale out

trans-unit.source: There are two methods of migrating an existing WordPress site to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: There are two methods of migrating an existing WordPress site to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: **<linkText>WordPress export[export]</linkText><title></title>** - This exports the content of your blog, which can then be imported to a new WordPress site on Azure App Service using the <linkText>WordPress importer plugin[import]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: **<linkText>WordPress export[export]</linkText><title></title>** - This exports the content of your blog, which can then be imported to a new WordPress site on Azure App Service using the <linkText>WordPress importer plugin[import]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: While this process allows you to migrate your content, it does not migrate any plugins, themes or other customizations.
trans-unit.target: While this process allows you to migrate your content, it does not migrate any plugins, themes or other customizations.

trans-unit.source: These must be installed again manually.
trans-unit.target: These must be installed again manually.

trans-unit.source: Manual migration - Back up your site[wordpressbackup] and database[wordpressdbbackup], then manually restore it to a web app in Azure App Service and associated MySQL database to migrate highly customized sites and avoid the tedium of manually installing plugins, themes, and other customizations.
trans-unit.target: Manual migration - Back up your site[wordpressbackup] and database[wordpressdbbackup], then manually restore it to a web app in Azure App Service and associated MySQL database to migrate highly customized sites and avoid the tedium of manually installing plugins, themes, and other customizations.

trans-unit.source: Use the <linkText>Azure Marketplace[cdbnstore]</linkText><title></title> to create a MySQL database of the size you identified in the <linkText>Architecture and planning</linkText><title></title> section, in the region(s) that you will host your site.
trans-unit.target: Use the <linkText>Azure Marketplace[cdbnstore]</linkText><title></title> to create a MySQL database of the size you identified in the <linkText>Architecture and planning</linkText><title></title> section, in the region(s) that you will host your site.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps in <linkText>Create a WordPress web app in Azure App Service[createwordpress]</linkText><title></title> to create a new WordPress web app.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps in <linkText>Create a WordPress web app in Azure App Service[createwordpress]</linkText><title></title> to create a new WordPress web app.

trans-unit.source: When creating the web app, select Use an existing MySQL Database and select the database created in step 1.
trans-unit.target: When creating the web app, select Use an existing MySQL Database and select the database created in step 1.

trans-unit.source: If you are migrating an existing WordPress site, see <linkText>Migrate an existing WordPress site to Azure</linkText><title></title> after creating a new web app.
trans-unit.target: If you are migrating an existing WordPress site, see <linkText>Migrate an existing WordPress site to Azure</linkText><title></title> after creating a new web app.

trans-unit.source: As mentioned in the <linkText>Architecture and planning</linkText><title></title> section, there are two ways to migrate a WordPress site.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned in the <linkText>Architecture and planning</linkText><title></title> section, there are two ways to migrate a WordPress site.

trans-unit.source: export and import - for sites without a lot of customization, or where you just want to move the content.
trans-unit.target: export and import - for sites without a lot of customization, or where you just want to move the content.

trans-unit.source: backup and restore - for sites with a lot of customization where you want to move everything.
trans-unit.target: backup and restore - for sites with a lot of customization where you want to move everything.

trans-unit.source: Use one of the following sections to migrate your site.
trans-unit.target: Use one of the following sections to migrate your site.

trans-unit.source: Use <linkText>WordPress export[export]</linkText><title></title> to export your existing site.
trans-unit.target: Use <linkText>WordPress export[export]</linkText><title></title> to export your existing site.

trans-unit.source: Create a new web app using the steps in the <linkText>Create a new WordPress site</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: Create a new web app using the steps in the <linkText>Create a new WordPress site</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: Login to your WordPress site on Web Apps and click on Plugins -> Add New.
trans-unit.target: Login to your WordPress site on Web Apps and click on Plugins -> Add New.

trans-unit.source: Search for, and install, the WordPress Importer plugin.
trans-unit.target: Search for, and install, the WordPress Importer plugin.

trans-unit.source: After the importer plugin has been installed, click on Tools -> Import, and then select WordPress to use the WordPress importer plugin.
trans-unit.target: After the importer plugin has been installed, click on Tools -> Import, and then select WordPress to use the WordPress importer plugin.

trans-unit.source: On the Import WordPress page, click Choose File.
trans-unit.target: On the Import WordPress page, click Choose File.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the WXR file exported from your existing WordPress site, and then choose Upload file and import.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the WXR file exported from your existing WordPress site, and then choose Upload file and import.

trans-unit.source: Click Submit.
trans-unit.target: Click Submit.

trans-unit.source: You will be prompted that the import was successful.
trans-unit.target: You will be prompted that the import was successful.

trans-unit.source: Once you have completed all these steps, restart your site from its web app blade in the <linkText>Azure preview portal[mgmtportal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Once you have completed all these steps, restart your site from its web app blade in the <linkText>Azure preview portal[mgmtportal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After importing the site, you may need to perform the following steps to enable settings not contained in the import file.
trans-unit.target: After importing the site, you may need to perform the following steps to enable settings not contained in the import file.

trans-unit.source: If you were using this...
trans-unit.target: If you were using this...

trans-unit.source: Do this...
trans-unit.target: Do this...

trans-unit.source: Permalinks
trans-unit.target: Permalinks

trans-unit.source: From the WordPress dashboard of the new site, click Settings -> Permalinks and then update the Permalinks structure
trans-unit.target: From the WordPress dashboard of the new site, click Settings -> Permalinks and then update the Permalinks structure

trans-unit.source: image/media links
trans-unit.target: image/media links

trans-unit.source: To update links to the new location, use the <linkText>Velvet Blues Update URLs plugin[velvet]</linkText><title></title>, a search and replace tool, or manually in your database
trans-unit.target: To update links to the new location, use the <linkText>Velvet Blues Update URLs plugin[velvet]</linkText><title></title>, a search and replace tool, or manually in your database

trans-unit.source: Themes
trans-unit.target: Themes

trans-unit.source: Go to Appearance -> Theme and update the site theme as needed
trans-unit.target: Go to Appearance -> Theme and update the site theme as needed

trans-unit.source: Menus
trans-unit.target: Menus

trans-unit.source: If your theme supports menus, links to your home page may still have the old sub-directory embedded in them.
trans-unit.target: If your theme supports menus, links to your home page may still have the old sub-directory embedded in them.

trans-unit.source: Go to Appearance -> Menus and update them
trans-unit.target: Go to Appearance -> Menus and update them

trans-unit.source: Back up your existing WordPress site using the information at <linkText>WordPress backups[wordpressbackup]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Back up your existing WordPress site using the information at <linkText>WordPress backups[wordpressbackup]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Back up your existing database using the information at <linkText>Backing up your database[wordpressdbbackup]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Back up your existing database using the information at <linkText>Backing up your database[wordpressdbbackup]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create a new database and restore the backup.
trans-unit.target: Create a new database and restore the backup.

trans-unit.source: Purchase a new database from the <linkText>Azure Marketplace[cdbnstore]</linkText><title></title>, or setup a MySQL database on a <linkText>Windows[mysqlwindows]</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Linux[mysqllinux]</linkText><title></title> VM.
trans-unit.target: Purchase a new database from the <linkText>Azure Marketplace[cdbnstore]</linkText><title></title>, or setup a MySQL database on a <linkText>Windows[mysqlwindows]</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Linux[mysqllinux]</linkText><title></title> VM.

trans-unit.source: Using a MySQL client like <linkText>MySQL Workbench[workbench]</linkText><title></title>, connect to the new database and import your WordPress database.
trans-unit.target: Using a MySQL client like <linkText>MySQL Workbench[workbench]</linkText><title></title>, connect to the new database and import your WordPress database.

trans-unit.source: Update the database to change the domain entries to your new Azure App Service domain.
trans-unit.target: Update the database to change the domain entries to your new Azure App Service domain.

trans-unit.source: For example, mywordpress.azurewebsites.net.
trans-unit.target: For example, mywordpress.azurewebsites.net.

trans-unit.source: Use the <linkText>Search and Replace for WordPress Databases Script[searchandreplace]</linkText><title></title> to safely change all instances.
trans-unit.target: Use the <linkText>Search and Replace for WordPress Databases Script[searchandreplace]</linkText><title></title> to safely change all instances.

trans-unit.source: Create a new web app in the Azure Portal and publish the WordPress backup.
trans-unit.target: Create a new web app in the Azure Portal and publish the WordPress backup.

trans-unit.source: Create a new web app in the Azure preview portal[mgmtportal] with a database using New -> Web + Mobile -> Azure Marketplace -> Web Apps -> Web app + SQL (or Web app + MySQL) -> Create.
trans-unit.target: Create a new web app in the Azure preview portal[mgmtportal] with a database using New -> Web + Mobile -> Azure Marketplace -> Web Apps -> Web app + SQL (or Web app + MySQL) -> Create.

trans-unit.source: Configure all the required settings to create an empty web app.
trans-unit.target: Configure all the required settings to create an empty web app.

trans-unit.source: In your WordPress backup, locate the wp-config.php file and open it in an editor.
trans-unit.target: In your WordPress backup, locate the wp-config.php file and open it in an editor.

trans-unit.source: Replace the following entries with the information for your new MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Replace the following entries with the information for your new MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: DB_NAME - the user name of the database
trans-unit.target: DB_NAME - the user name of the database

trans-unit.source: DB_USER - the user name used to access the database
trans-unit.target: DB_USER - the user name used to access the database

trans-unit.source: DB_PASSWORD - the user password
trans-unit.target: DB_PASSWORD - the user password

trans-unit.source: After changing these entries, save and close the wp-config.php file.
trans-unit.target: After changing these entries, save and close the wp-config.php file.

trans-unit.source: Use the <linkText>Deploy a web app in Azure App Service[deploy]</linkText><title></title> information to enable the deployment method you wish to use, and then deploy your WordPress backup to your web app in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Use the <linkText>Deploy a web app in Azure App Service[deploy]</linkText><title></title> information to enable the deployment method you wish to use, and then deploy your WordPress backup to your web app in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Once the WordPress site has been deployed, you should be able to access the new site (as an App Service web app) using the *.azurewebsite.net URL for the site.
trans-unit.target: Once the WordPress site has been deployed, you should be able to access the new site (as an App Service web app) using the *.azurewebsite.net URL for the site.

trans-unit.source: After the WordPress site has been created or migrated, use the following information to improve performance or enable additional functionality.
trans-unit.target: After the WordPress site has been created or migrated, use the following information to improve performance or enable additional functionality.

trans-unit.source: To do this...
trans-unit.target: To do this...

trans-unit.source: Use this...
trans-unit.target: Use this...

trans-unit.source: Set App Service plan mode, size, and enable scaling
trans-unit.target: Set App Service plan mode, size, and enable scaling

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale a web app in Azure App Service[websitescale]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale a web app in Azure App Service[websitescale]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source:
Enable persistent database connections

By default, WordPress does not use persistent database connections, which may cause your connection to the database to become throttled after multiple connections.
trans-unit.target:
Enable persistent database connections

By default, WordPress does not use persistent database connections, which may cause your connection to the database to become throttled after multiple connections.

trans-unit.source:
1. Edit the wp-includes/wp-db.php file.

  2. Find the following line.

    $this->dbh = mysqlconnect( $this->dbhost, $this->dbuser, $this->dbpassword, $newlink, $clientflags );

  3. Replace the previous line with the following.

    $this->dbh = mysqlpconnect( $this->dbhost, $this->dbuser, $this->dbpassword, $clientflags );
    if ( false !== $error    reporting ) { /br/>  errorreporting( $errorreporting );
    }

  4. Find the following line.

    $this->dbh = @mysqlconnect( $this->dbhost, $this->dbuser, $this->dbpassword, $newlink, $clientflags );

  5. Replace the above line with the following.

    $this->dbh = @mysqlpconnect( $this->dbhost, $this->dbuser, $this->dbpassword, $clientflags );

  6. Save the file wp-includes/wp-db.php file and redeploy the site.

These changes may be overwritten when WordPress is updated.

WordPress defaults to automatic updates, which can be disabled by editing the wp-config.php file and adding define ( 'WPAUTOUPDATECORE', false );

Another way of addressing updates would be to use a WebJob that monitors the wp-db.php file and performs the above modifications each time the file is updated. See Introduction to WebJobs for more information.
trans-unit.target:
1. Edit the wp-includes/wp-db.php file.

  2. Find the following line.

    $this->dbh = mysqlconnect( $this->dbhost, $this->dbuser, $this->dbpassword, $newlink, $clientflags );

  3. Replace the previous line with the following.

    $this->dbh = mysqlpconnect( $this->dbhost, $this->dbuser, $this->dbpassword, $clientflags );
    if ( false !== $error    reporting ) { /br/>  errorreporting( $errorreporting );
    }

  4. Find the following line.

    $this->dbh = @mysqlconnect( $this->dbhost, $this->dbuser, $this->dbpassword, $newlink, $clientflags );

  5. Replace the above line with the following.

    $this->dbh = @mysqlpconnect( $this->dbhost, $this->dbuser, $this->dbpassword, $clientflags );

  6. Save the file wp-includes/wp-db.php file and redeploy the site.

These changes may be overwritten when WordPress is updated.

WordPress defaults to automatic updates, which can be disabled by editing the wp-config.php file and adding define ( 'WPAUTOUPDATECORE', false );

Another way of addressing updates would be to use a WebJob that monitors the wp-db.php file and performs the above modifications each time the file is updated. See Introduction to WebJobs for more information.

trans-unit.source: Improve performance
trans-unit.target: Improve performance

trans-unit.source:
• Disable the ARR cookie - can improve performance when running WordPress on multiple Web Apps instances

  • Enable caching. Redis cache (preview) can be used with the Redis object cache WordPress plugin, or use one of the other caching offerings from the Azure Store

  • How to make WordPress faster with Wincache - Wincache is enabled by default for Web Apps

  • Scale a web app in Azure App Service and use ClearDB High Availability Routing or MySQL Cluster CGE
trans-unit.target:
• Disable the ARR cookie - can improve performance when running WordPress on multiple Web Apps instances

  • Enable caching. Redis cache (preview) can be used with the Redis object cache WordPress plugin, or use one of the other caching offerings from the Azure Store

  • How to make WordPress faster with Wincache - Wincache is enabled by default for Web Apps

  • Scale a web app in Azure App Service and use ClearDB High Availability Routing or MySQL Cluster CGE

trans-unit.source: Use blobs for storage
trans-unit.target: Use blobs for storage

trans-unit.source:
1. Create an Azure Storage account

  2. Learn how to Use the Content Distribution Network (CDN) to geo-distribute data stored in blobs.

  3. Install and configure the Azure Storage for WordPress plugin.

    For detailed setup and configuration information for the plugin, see the user guide.
trans-unit.target:
1. Create an Azure Storage account

  2. Learn how to Use the Content Distribution Network (CDN) to geo-distribute data stored in blobs.

  3. Install and configure the Azure Storage for WordPress plugin.

    For detailed setup and configuration information for the plugin, see the user guide.

trans-unit.source: Enable email
trans-unit.target: Enable email

trans-unit.source:
1. Enable SendGrid using the Azure Store

  2. Install the SendGrid plugin for WordPress
trans-unit.target:
1. Enable SendGrid using the Azure Store

  2. Install the SendGrid plugin for WordPress
